titles.en: THE BOOK OF BELIEF (Emān) AND DISBELIEF (KUFR)

titles.ar: بَابُ الِاهْتِمَامِ بِأُمُورِ الْمُسْلِمِينَ وَ النَّصِيحَةِ لَهُمْ وَ نَفْعِهِمْ
titles.en: Chapter 70 – The concern with the affairs of the Muslims, and the advising to them, and benefitting them

titles.ar: بَابُ الِاهْتِمَامِ بِأُمُورِ الْمُسْلِمِينَ وَ النَّصِيحَةِ لَهُمْ وَ نَفْعِهِمْ
titles.en: Chapter 70 – The concern with the affairs of the Muslims, and the advising to them, and benefitting them

verses.text: عَلِيُّ بْنُ إِبْرَاهِيمَ عَنْ أَبِيهِ عَنِ النَّوْفَلِيِّ عَنِ السَّكُونِيِّ عَنْ أَبِي عَبْدِ اللَّهِ ( عليه السلام ) قَالَ قَالَ رَسُولُ اللَّهِ ( صلى الله عليه وآله ) مَنْ أَصْبَحَ لَا يَهْتَمُّ بِأُمُورِ الْمُسْلِمِينَ فَلَيْسَ بِمُسْلِمٍ .

translations.name: hubeali
translations.text:
Ali Bin Ibrahim, from his father, from Al Nowfaly, from Sakuny, 
(It has been narrated) from Abu Abdullah<sup>asws</sup> having said: ‘Rasool-Allah<sup>saww</sup> said: ‘The one who awakens in the morning not being concerned with the affairs of the Muslims, so he is not a Muslim’’.

verses.text: وَ بِهَذَا الْإِسْنَادِ قَالَ قَالَ رَسُولُ اللَّهِ ( صلى الله عليه وآله ) أَنْسَكُ النَّاسِ نُسُكاً أَنْصَحُهُمْ جَيْباً وَ أَسْلَمُهُمْ قَلْباً لِجَمِيعِ الْمُسْلِمِينَ .

translations.name: hubeali
translations.text: And by this chain, ‘He<sup>asws</sup> said: ‘Rasool-Allah<sup>saww</sup> said: ‘The most diligent of the people in rituals is the one most sincere in advising them, and the most submissive of them in hearts to the entirety of the Muslims’.

verses.text: عَلِيُّ بْنُ إِبْرَاهِيمَ عَنْ عَلِيِّ بْنِ مُحَمَّدٍ الْقَاسَانِيِّ عَنِ الْقَاسِمِ بْنِ مُحَمَّدٍ عَنْ سُلَيْمَانَ بْنِ دَاوُدَ الْمِنْقَرِيِّ عَنْ سُفْيَانَ بْنِ عُيَيْنَةَ قَالَ سَمِعْتُ أَبَا عَبْدِ اللَّهِ ( عليه السلام ) يَقُولُ عَلَيْكَ بِالنُّصْحِ لِلَّهِ فِي خَلْقِهِ فَلَنْ تَلْقَاهُ بِعَمَلٍ أَفْضَلَ مِنْهُ .

translations.name: hubeali
translations.text:
Ali Bin Ibrahim, from Ali Bin Muhammad Al Qasany, from Al Qasim Bin Muhammad, from Suleyman Bin Dawood Al Minqary, from Sufyan Bin Uyayna who said, 
‘I heard Abu Abdullah<sup>asws</sup> saying: ‘Upon you is with the advising among His<sup>azwj</sup> creatures, for you will never (be able to) meet Him<sup>azwj</sup> with a deed more superior than it’.

verses.text: مُحَمَّدُ بْنُ يَحْيَى عَنْ أَحْمَدَ بْنِ مُحَمَّدِ بْنِ عِيسَى عَنِ ابْنِ مَحْبُوبٍ عَنْ مُحَمَّدِ بْنِ الْقَاسِمِ الْهَاشِمِيِّ عَنْ أَبِي عَبْدِ اللَّهِ ( عليه السلام ) قَالَ مَنْ لَمْ يَهْتَمَّ بِأُمُورِ الْمُسْلِمِينَ فَلَيْسَ بِمُسْلِمٍ .

translations.name: hubeali
translations.text:
Muhammad Bin Yahya, from Ahmad Bin Muhammad Bin Isa, from Ibn Mahboub, from Muhammad Bin Al Qasim Al Hashimy, 
(It has been narrated) from Abu Abdullah<sup>asws</sup> having said: ‘The one who is not concerned with the affairs of the Muslims, so he is not a Muslim’.

verses.text: عَنْهُ عَنْ سَلَمَةَ بْنِ الْخَطَّابِ عَنْ سُلَيْمَانَ بْنِ سَمَاعَةَ عَنْ عَمِّهِ عَاصِمٍ الْكُوزِيِّ عَنْ أَبِي عَبْدِ اللَّهِ ( عليه السلام ) أَنَّ النَّبِيَّ ( صلى الله عليه وآله ) قَالَ مَنْ أَصْبَحَ لَا يَهْتَمُّ بِأُمُورِ الْمُسْلِمِينَ فَلَيْسَ مِنْهُمْ وَ مَنْ سَمِعَ رَجُلًا يُنَادِي يَا لَلْمُسْلِمِينَ فَلَمْ يُجِبْهُ فَلَيْسَ بِمُسْلِمٍ .

translations.name: hubeali
translations.text:
From him, from Salma Bin Al Khattab, from Suleyman Bin Sama’at, from his uncle Aasim Al Houzy, 
(It has been narrated) from Abu Abdullah<sup>asws</sup> that the Prophet<sup>saww</sup> said: ‘The one who awakens in the morning not being concerned with the affairs of the Muslims, so he is not from them; and the one who hears a man calling, ‘O Muslims!’, and he does not answer him, so he is not a Muslim’.

verses.text: عَلِيُّ بْنُ إِبْرَاهِيمَ عَنْ أَبِيهِ عَنِ النَّوْفَلِيِّ عَنِ السَّكُونِيِّ عَنْ أَبِي عَبْدِ اللَّهِ ( عليه السلام ) قَالَ قَالَ رَسُولُ اللَّهِ ( صلى الله عليه وآله ) الْخَلْقُ عِيَالُ اللَّهِ فَأَحَبُّ الْخَلْقِ إِلَى اللَّهِ مَنْ نَفَعَ عِيَالَ اللَّهِ وَ أَدْخَلَ عَلَى أَهْلِ بَيْتٍ سُرُوراً .

translations.name: hubeali
translations.text:
Ali Bin Ibrahim, from his father, from Al Nowfaly, from Al Sakny, 
(It has been narrated) from Abu Abdullah<sup>asws</sup> having said: ‘Rasool-Allah<sup>saww</sup> said: ‘The people are the dependants of Allah<sup>azwj</sup>. Therefore, the most beloved of the people to Allah<sup>azwj</sup> is the one who benefits the dependants of Allah<sup>azwj</sup> the most, and enters the cheerfulness upon the family members’.

verses.text: عِدَّةٌ مِنْ أَصْحَابِنَا عَنْ أَحْمَدَ بْنِ مُحَمَّدِ بْنِ خَالِدٍ عَنْ عَلِيِّ بْنِ الْحَكَمِ عَنْ سَيْفِ بْنِ عَمِيرَةَ قَالَ حَدَّثَنِي مَنْ سَمِعَ أَبَا عَبْدِ اللَّهِ ( عليه السلام ) يَقُولُ سُئِلَ رَسُولُ اللَّهِ ( صلى الله عليه وآله ) مَنْ أَحَبُّ النَّاسِ إِلَى اللَّهِ قَالَ أَنْفَعُ النَّاسِ لِلنَّاسِ .

translations.name: hubeali
translations.text:
A number of our companions, from Ahmad Bin Muhammad Bin Khalid, from Ali Bin Al Hakam, from Sayf Bin Ameyra who said, 
‘It was narrated to me by the one who heard Abu Abdullah<sup>asws</sup> saying: ‘Rasool-Allah<sup>saww</sup> was asked, ‘Who is the most Beloved of the people to Allah<sup>azwj</sup>?’ He<sup>saww</sup> said: ‘The most beneficial of the people to the people’.

verses.text: عَنْهُ عَنْ عَلِيِّ بْنِ الْحَكَمِ عَنْ مُثَنَّى بْنِ الْوَلِيدِ الْحَنَّاطِ عَنْ فِطْرِ بْنِ خَلِيفَةَ عَنْ عُمَرَ بْنِ عَلِيِّ بْنِ الْحُسَيْنِ عَنْ أَبِيهِ ( صلوات الله عليه )  قَالَ قَالَ رَسُولُ اللَّهِ ( صلى الله عليه وآله ) مَنْ رَدَّ عَنْ قَوْمٍ مِنَ الْمُسْلِمِينَ عَادِيَةَ [مَاءٍ] أَوْ نَارٍ أُوجِبَتْ لَهُ الْجَنَّةُ .

translations.name: hubeali
translations.text:
From him, from Ali Bin Al Hakam, from Usna Bin Al Waleed Al hannat Bin Khaleefa, 
(It has been narrated) from Umar, son of Ali<sup>asws</sup> Bin Al-Husayn<sup>asws</sup>, from his father<sup>asws</sup> having said: ‘Rasool-Allah<sup>saww</sup> said: ‘The one who repels from a group of Muslims, an adversity of water or fire, the Paradise would be Obligated for him’.

verses.text: عَنْهُ عَنِ ابْنِ فَضَّالٍ عَنْ ثَعْلَبَةَ بْنِ مَيْمُونٍ عَنْ مُعَاوِيَةَ بْنِ عَمَّارٍ عَنْ أَبِي عَبْدِ اللَّهِ ( عليه السلام ) فِي قَوْلِ اللَّهِ عَزَّ وَ جَلَّ وَ قُولُوا لِلنَّاسِ حُسْناً قَالَ قُولُوا لِلنَّاسِ حُسْناً وَ لَا تَقُولُوا إِلَّا خَيْراً حَتَّى تَعْلَمُوا مَا هُوَ .

translations.name: hubeali
translations.text: From him, from Ibn Fazzal, from Sa’alba Bin Maymoun, from Muawiya Bin Ammar, (It has been narrated) from Abu Abdullahasws regarding the Words of Allahazwj Mighty and Majestic [2:83] and you shall speak to the people good words, said: ‘Speak good words to the people and do not be saying anything except for good until you learn what it is’.

verses.text: عَنْهُ عَنِ ابْنِ أَبِي نَجْرَانَ عَنْ أَبِي جَمِيلَةَ الْمُفَضَّلِ بْنِ صَالِحٍ عَنْ جَابِرِ بْنِ يَزِيدَ عَنْ أَبِي جَعْفَرٍ ( عليه السلام ) قَالَ فِي قَوْلِ اللَّهِ عَزَّ وَ جَلَّ وَ قُولُوا لِلنَّاسِ حُسْناً قَالَ قُولُوا لِلنَّاسِ أَحْسَنَ مَا تُحِبُّونَ أَنْ يُقَالَ فِيكُمْ .

translations.name: hubeali
translations.text: From him, from Ibn Abu Najran, from Abu Jameela Al Mufazzal Bin Salih, from Jabir Bin Yazeed, (It has been narrated) from Abu Ja’farasws having said regarding the Words of Allahazwj Mighty and Majestic [2:83] and you shall speak to the people good words: ‘Speak good words to the people, better than what you would love to be spoken regarding yourselves’.

verses.text: عِدَّةٌ مِنْ أَصْحَابِنَا عَنْ سَهْلِ بْنِ زِيَادٍ عَنْ يَحْيَى بْنِ الْمُبَارَكِ عَنْ عَبْدِ اللَّهِ بْنِ جَبَلَةَ عَنْ رَجُلٍ عَنْ أَبِي عَبْدِ اللَّهِ ( عليه السلام ) قَالَ فِي قَوْلِ اللَّهِ عَزَّ وَ جَلَّ وَ جَعَلَنِي مُبارَكاً أَيْنَ ما كُنْتُ قَالَ نَفَّاعاً .

translations.name: hubeali
translations.text: A number of our companions, from Sahl Bin Ziyad, from Yahya Bin Al Mubarak, from Abdullah Bin Jabala, from a man, (It has been narrated) from Abu Abdullahasws having said regarding the Words of Allahazwj Mighty and Majestic [19:31] And He has Made me (Isaas) Blessed wherever I may be: Heasws said: ‘Beneficial (to the people)’.
